item.title: Connecting and using PostgreSQL to a NodeJS app
item.description: Quick intro This is a short blog post on how to connect Postgres to a NodeJS app. This isn’t that hard to do but I figured I might as well write it down as I’m going to be doing this a lot in the future.

item.title: HackTheBox Remote Write Up w/o Metasploit
item.description: This is an easy Windows box by mrb3n. For initial foothold we need to find and crack creds found in NFS and use them in an exploit so we can get RCE.

item.title: HackTheBox Traceback Write Up w/o Metasploit
item.description: Traceback is an easy Linux box created by Xh4H. You have to enter a shell planted on the server, enter as webadmin, escalate privileges with lua/luvit to sysadmin and echo a reverse shell in 00-header file to get root access.

item.title: Privacy
item.description: Privacy Policy for ajdin.io At ajdin.io, accessible from https://ajdin.io, one of our main priorities is the privacy of our visitors. This Privacy Policy document contains types of information that is collected and recorded by ajdin.

item.title: Building Worklog: a PERN stack web application
item.description: Introduction I’ll be building a simple web application to log workers’ activity. I’ll be using PostgresSQL for database, React for front end and Express for routing the app.

item.title: CSRF Token Extraction
item.description: So I was doing a CTF challenge and I have learned how to bypass CSRF token protection with extracting the token.

item.title: HackTheBox Openadmin Write Up
item.description: Reconnaissance Let’s see what have we got here with nmap. nmap -sC -sV -O -oA nmap/initial 10.10.10.171 -sC: run default script scan -sV: probe open ports to determine service/version info -O: OS detection -oA: output OS detection, version detection, script scanning, and traceroute Nmap returns the results quick as it by default scans only for most popular 1000 ports, so lets scan all the ports while we investigate the initial nmap scan.

item.title: HackTheBox Mango Write Up
item.description: Reconnaissance Let’s run nmap, sudo nmap -sV -sC -O -oA nmap/initial 10.10.10.162 We have to use https for this website on port 80, and we can get this “search page”.

item.title: HackTheBox Postman Write Up
item.description: Reconnaissance Let’s run a quick nmap scan as always. # nmap -sV -sC -O -oA nmap/initial 10.10.10.160 Short explanation: -sV Version detection -sC Script scan -O Enable OS detection -oA Output to all formats For a more detailed explanation click here.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a computer science student @ UniZg. I’m interested in development and security of modern web applications. I have created this website to take notes when I see fit.
